poem:
### A Crisis of Conscience

In narrow cells, they cage the voices
of earth's frail cry and muted protest.
Bars cannot hold the breath of truth;
the wind will wail where walls suppress.
In shadows of steel, freedom's whispers linger,
undefiled by silence, unyielding as stone.
The real prisoners roam unshackled;
injustice wears the warden's crown.
